com.bluegosling.collections

Class ArrayUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bluegosling.collections.ArrayUtils

  • public final class ArrayUtils
extends Object
    Utility methods for working with arrays that back collection implementations. This class also includes functionality for manipulating "auto-resizing" arrays, like the ones used to implement array-backed collections.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • insertItem

        public static <T> T[] insertItem(T element,
                                 int index,
                                 T[] data,
                                 int size)
        Insert an item into an array, shifting elements around if necessary. If the array is not large enough to fit another element, a larger array will be allocated and its contents will be populated. The array with the new element will be returned, be that the original object or a new, larger one. If a larger array is created, it is grown by 50% of the given array's size, just like as performed by maybeGrowBy(Object[], int, int).
        Parameters:
        element - the element to insert into the array
        index - the index at which the specified item will be inserted
        data - the array
        size - the actual number of items in the array
        Returns:
        an array with the specified element inserted at the specified index

      • removeIndex

        public static void removeIndex(int index,
                               Object[] data,
                               int size)
        Removes the an item from the specified array, shifting elements around if necessary.
        Parameters:
        index - the index in the array of the item to remove
        data - the array
        size - the actual number of items in the array

      • reverse

        public static void reverse(Object[] a)
        Reverses the specified array in place.
        Parameters:
        a - the array to be reversed.

      • newArrayIfTooSmall

        public static <T> T[] newArrayIfTooSmall(T[] array,
                                         int requiredCapacity)
        Returns the specified array if it has sufficient capacity or a new larger array otherwise. If a larger array is created and returned, it will have all null values. In other words, no copying is performed from the given array to the new array in the case that a new array is created.
        Parameters:
        array - the array
        requiredCapacity - the required capacity
        Returns:
        an array with the same component type as the one specified that is large enough to hold the specified capacity (may be same instance as specified array if it is already large enough)

      • maybeGrowBy

        public static <T> T[] maybeGrowBy(T[] array,
                                  int actualSize,
                                  int extraCapacityNeeded)
        Grows the array if necessary to accommodate additional items. This tries to grow the array by 50%, so that repeated calls will have an amortized runtime complexity of O(1). It will grow the array by more than 50% if necessary to accommodate the indicated extra capacity.
        Parameters:
        array - the array
        actualSize - the used size of the array, which may be less than its actual length
        extraCapacityNeeded - the number of additional items for which room in the array is needed, above and beyond its used size
        Returns:
        the specified array if it already has sufficient capacity or a new, larger array that is initialized with the same elements (from index 0 to index actualSize - 1)
